results.title: ADHA: attention deficit hyperactivity disorder
results.brief_description: Dr. Christopher Green, author of the famous “Toddler taming” and “Babies”, is a leading authority on Attention Deficit Disorder. This program, designed for parents, teachers and healthcare professionals, investigates key issues about the disorder. It examines ADHD in the under 5’s, school age children, and adults, as well as covering diagnosis, behaviour techniques, alternative treatment and medication.

results.title: Adelaide advances
results.creator_credit: Carl Kayser, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Auster Films
results.brief_description: A description of the city and suburbs of Adelaide since foundation. A father is driving his son to one of the research laboratories and as they approach the city, he tells the boy of local industries and the contributions made to the South Australian economy by the Agricultural Research Institute. Includes scenes of the landmarks of the city and a visit to the Onkaparinga Racecourse. Sponsored by the Australian News & Information Bureau and narrated by David Low.

results.title: Actualization through assertion
results.creator_credit: Barnett Addis, Robert Liberman, Larry King and Research Press
results.brief_description: Four clients are seen in group assertion training, developing a style by practicing appropriate eye contact, gestures, body movement, touch, facial expression, voice tone and volume. Therapists are seen directing the client’s progress and reinforcing small successes. Practice assignments are given in which newly learned skills are applid to situations in client’s daily lives.

results.title: Acts of Kindness
results.creator_credit: Michael Landy, Pinky Ghundale, Film London and Channel 4
results.brief_description: A celebration of everyday acts of kindness that happen on London Underground every day of the year. The film originated from ‘Acts of Kindness’, a project by Michael Landy for London Underground, commissioned by Art on the Underground, London Underground Limited, 2011-12.

results.title: Action: the October crisis of 1970
results.creator_credit: Robin Spry, Tom Daly, Normand Cloutier and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A long and thoughtful look at those desperate days of October 1970, when Montreal awaited the outcome of FLQ terrorist acts. This film puts the October Crisis in the long perspective of history. Compiled from news and other films, it shows independence movements past and present, and their leaders; it reflects the mingled relief, dismay, defiance, when the Canadian army came to Montreal; and it shows how political leaders viewed the intervention. Edited by Shelagh Mackenzie adn Joan Henson. Sound by Bernie Bordeleau. (Awards: Nyon, Chicago, Niagara-on-the Lake)

results.title: Across the Sea of Galilee
results.brief_description: Filmed on the eve of the historic Arafat Peace Agreement and records the daily lives and views of Jews, Palestinians and Christians. We learn how they perceive their country during this time of change, how they deal with constant war and the conflicts of the different religions in the Middle East. We are taken on a series of adventures; camel riding across the Negev Desert to meet nomadic Bedouin tribesman, kibbutz living on a Lebanon border and driving tanks in the Golan Heights. We also see female soldiers on the Syrian border, a Jewish wedding and the ultra-orthodox Jews of Mea Shearim who dress in 18th Centruy styles from Eastern Europe.

results.title: acmipark
results.material_description: interactive software, computers, monitors, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
acmipark is multiplayer virtual world. Created by selectparks (artists Julian Oliver, Chad Chatterton, and Andrea Blundell), it was designed to extend the physical spaces of the Australian Centre for the Moving Image (ACMI) at Melbourne’s Federation Square into the realms of virtual space. It was produced using a game engine as its base, and worked up from the real architectural designs produced for Federation Square by Lab Architecture Studio.

Designed as a soundpark, it is a musical instrument which can be played collectively, and, like Federation Square itself, it was envisaged as a kind of public space waiting for a community to define its meaning.

It was conceived as an experiment in the design of a virtual public space. It is an embodiment of the idea that we are moving our public space into the realm of the virtual. By using a model of a real world public space combined with the collaborative possibilities of the soundpark and the kinaesthetic pleasures of moving through a beautiful virtual place, selectparks hoped to build upon traditional concepts of ‘public’ places.

[Source: Helen Stuckey, 2006 https://firstmonday.org/ojs/index.php/fm/article/view/1561/1476 last accessed 20/10/2020]

results.title: ACMI in the Regions: Remembering Culgoa Primary School
results.creator_credit: David Meagher, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Culgoa Primary School closed its doors for the last time in December 2008, after over 100 years of service, due to the low student intake for the coming year. This film captures moments from a reunion organised to bring together students and teachers in celebration of times past. The town and its people are evidence of the strength and fragility of modern day living in small rural towns. The real, everyday struggles that farmers face and the heartbreaking decisions that families make, whether to stay and “tough it out” or move to a larger satellite town.

results.title: ACMI Animation Open Studios: three weekends in September and October 2007
results.creator_credit: Jason White and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: Three animators - Dave Jones, Nick Hilligoss, Steve Piscopo - participated in three weekends over September and October 2007 in the ACMI Animation Open Studios (as part of Pixar) sharing their secrets with people of all ages. Using a combination of moving image, stills and animation to a music soundtrack, this is a record of what took place.
